original_text: Ant Group's world record-setting initial public offering has been suspended. Its controller, executive chairman, and CEO were summoned and interviewed by regulators in China. The company later reported significant issues that prevented it from listing. New draft rules for online micro-lending were issued on Monday by the Chinese central bank and regulators. The company was planning to raise just under 34.5 billion in a dual listing in Shanghai and Hong Kong on Thursday. It will continue to work through regulatory concerns with the Hong Kong and Shanghai stock exchanges.
text: Ant Group's world record-setting initial public offering has been suspended. Its controller, executive chairman, and CEO were summoned and interviewed by regulators in China. The company later reported significant issues that prevented it from listing. New draft rules for online micro-lending were issued on Monday by the Chinese central bank and regulators. The company was planning to raise just under 34.5 billion in a dual listing in Shanghai and Hong Kong on Thursday. It will continue to work through regulatory concerns with the Hong Kong and Shanghai stock exchanges.

original_text: Matt Dupree recently wrapped up a job search after around 65 days. During that time, Dupree applied for 16 jobs, attended seven interviews, and received two offers. Many companies required Dupree to complete coding challenges, and he prepared for these interviews through online exercises. The main factor for success in these interviews was preparation. In the end, Dupree received an offer but countered it - resulting in a better salary. A link to a talk on salary negotiation is available in the article.

original_text: This repository contains a collection of XSS payloads that can be used in different contexts. A list of current payloads is available and a working demo is linked. While the payloads are not exhaustive, they are useful in a number of different scenarios. As a collection of XSS payloads it can be used to test that the various layers of your application are not vulnerable to XSS. As a library of payloads that work it can be used to create your own payloads. In addition to the above it can also be used as a means of education. The official web site can be found here.

This repository contains links to the Android Security Course from EdX, the videos for the 2014 BlackHat Mobile Security Summit, and some Android Security Resources. This repository contains links to iOS Security Resources. I am aware that there are not as many resources on iOS as on Android. I will add to this repository as I become aware of new things.
text: This is a repository of security resources for mobile devices and mobile operating systems, including Android and iOS, that I have found to be of interest to security researchers.

original_text: Open source code has been essential for China's rapidly growing tech sector. GitHub has been a large part of this growth, but its future in China is uncertain. Many fear that the Chinese government might ban the site for hosting censored information, or that US regulators could ban the company from doing business with Chinese firms. The Chinese government has championed Gitee, a domestic alternative, and Chinese firms have created the OpenAtom Foundation, an organization analogous to The Linux Foundation. While the Chinese government supports open-source development, it has objections to the free and open exchange of information, which could damage these efforts.

The Chinese government has championed Gitee, a domestic alternative, and Chinese firms have created the OpenAtom Foundation, an organization analogous to The Linux Foundation. While the Chinese government supports open-source development, it has objections to the free and open exchange of information, which could damage these efforts.

original_text: Amazon is in advanced talks to buy self-driving startup Zoox, which was valued at 3.2 billion in 2018. The deal is still being finalized and discussions could still fall apart. Zoox is considered to be one of the top contenders to build self-driving cars. However, the company has yet to ship a commercial vehicle. An internal email sent by Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos to staff indicates that the e-commerce giant is planning to open up a new healthcare center in Seattle. The center will be located next to Amazon's existing headquarters and will cater to employees and their families. Amazon has been making moves into healthcare since hiring a former hospital CEO last year. Amazon's first supermarket brand, Amazon Go, is set to open in New York City this spring. This will be the first location in the city for the company's cashierless stores. In addition to a location in the city, Amazon has plans to open two more stores in Seattle and San Francisco. The stores sell prepared foods, groceries, and other items. The world's biggest retailers are expanding their presence in New York City. The city is attracting retailers for its high population density, strong tourism, and growing economy. Target, Walmart, Whole Foods, and Amazon are just a few of the companies that have announced new stores in the city in recent months. Amazon's own devices and entertainment services were responsible for 15 of the company's 2019 sales. The company's devices unit includes its Echo speakers and Fire TV streaming sticks, while its entertainment division is responsible for Prime Video and music streaming. Apple is also expected to report record growth in its services business later today. Amazon and Apple's services are two of the best subscription businesses in the market today. Each company's services segment is expected to report record sales today. In addition, both companies have been successful in signing up new customers and getting them to spend more on the platforms.

original_text: Java attempts to run trusted and untrusted code within the same virtual machine, with the only thing separating them being the permission system and visibility modifiers. A bug anywhere in the JVM or standard libraries is liable to become a security vulnerability. This article discusses how a vulnerability was found in the Java version of Google App Engine and how it was developed into an exploit that could run arbitrary code on a Google server.

This article discusses how a vulnerability was found in the Java version of Google App Engine and how it was developed into an exploit that could run arbitrary code on a Google server.

original_text: Spotify has bought The Ringer, a podcast-centric media company owned by Bill Simmons. Simmons and his employees will all be absorbed in the deal. The Ringer has around 30 titles, ranging from an NBA chat show to a show devoted to rewatching old movies. Neither company disclosed a sale price for the deal, which is expected to close in the first quarter of this year. Spotify did not make Gimlet Media's podcasts exclusive to its platform when it purchased the company last year, so The Ringer's podcasts should still be available on all platforms. This is the fourth podcast company Spotify has acquired in the last 12 months.

original_text: GitHub Actions is an API for cause and effect on GitHub. Developers can orchestrate any workflow, based on any event, and GitHub will manage the execution and provide rich feedback while securing every step along the way. After receiving feedback from developers, GitHub has implemented CICD for any OS, any language, and any cloud. GitHub Actions is currently in beta and will be generally available on November 13.

original_text: In recent years, China has created an armada of huge ships that dredge up sand from the ocean floor. The largest of these ships can suck up 8,000 cubic yards of sand per hour. They then use that sand to build man-made islands in the South China Sea, one of the world's busiest shipping routes. Many countries lay claim to the Spratly Islands in the middle of the sea. In the last 18 months, China has used these ships to add nearly 3,000 acres of new land to their portion of the Spratlys, and is now installing surface to air missiles, runways for military aircraft, and ports for warships. This sand is causing environmental problems, as it is dumped on top of coral and causing "the most rapid rate of permanent loss of coral reef area in human history."

original_text: TF Quant Finance is a high-performance TensorFlow library for quantitative finance. It provides TensorFlow support for foundational mathematical methods, mid-level methods, and specific pricing models. End-to-end examples are available. Please visit our website tfqf.org for a quick tour and get started with TF Quant Finance. TF Quant Finance is an open-source project. It is distributed under the Apache License.

original_text: Being a solo founder can be difficult and it can take a while to find a rhythm that works without burning out. Patience and perseverance will help with dealing with the roller coaster of emotions that comes with the job. Being a solo founder can be difficult and it can take a while to find a rhythm that works without burning out. Patience and perseverance will help with dealing with the roller coaster of emotions that comes with the job. I hope these suggestions will help. This is the hardest part of being a solo founder, but it is also the most important. You need to identify who your customers are, why they will buy your product, what problem it solves for them, and why they will buy it from you. The founder needs to live and breathe the vision of the company. This vision will help with keeping you motivated when things get tough. When you have a vision for your company you need to focus on it. As a solo founder, you have to be careful what you spend your time on. Time is your most precious commodity. Don't get side tracked with something that does not further your goals. As a solo founder, you need to be able to quickly answer questions like: Who is your product for? What is the value of your product? How much does it cost? Why should someone buy it? Don't waste time trying to do it all. Focus on one thing and do it well. Nothing is more demotivating than not being able to get the things you need. The founder of a startup needs to be able to write code, market the product, and a million other tasks. You cannot be an expert in all of these areas. You can get things done by outsourcing andor getting a co-founder. The foundation of every company is the business model. It is critical to have a clear understanding of the business model. The founder must have a firm grasp of the finances of the company. Social media can be a great way to promote a product. It can also be a huge distraction. Don't waste time on social media unless you are generating revenue from it.
text: In our series of letters from small business owners we are looking at what it is like to be a solo founder and what you need to know to be successful.

original_text: Blue Origin launched the fourteenth test flight of its New Shepard rocket booster and capsule on January 14. There were no passengers on board, but the capsule can carry up to six people. New Shepard is designed to send crews and cargo to suborbital space, and this test flight is part of Blue Origin's goal to send people to space this year. The New Shepard capsule is designed to carry humans on suborbital flights. Blue OriginTwitter Blue Origin, the spaceflight company founded by Jeff Bezos, launched its 14th test flight of New Shepard on January 14. The rocket and its capsule lifted off from Blue Origin's West Texas launch site at about 11:43 a.m. ET. It was the 14th time Blue Origin had tested its suborbital rocket. The rocket is designed to carry people to suborbital space, and the company hopes to start sending tourists to space in 2019. Blue Origin has been working on reusable rockets to reach suborbital space for a few years now. Jeff Bezos, the billionaire founder of Amazon and Blue Origin, wants to send tourists to space this year. On Tuesday, Blue Origin launched the 14th test flight of its suborbital rocket, New Shepard, from its launch site in Van Horn, Texas. The rocket carried no passengers this time, but the capsule atop it can carry up to six people. Bezos said in a tweet that the flight reached an apogee - or peak altitude - of 351,000 feet, which was a record for New Shepard. Blue Origin's 14th test flight of New Shepard has reached a maximum altitude of 351,000 feet. This is the highest altitude reached by NewShepard so far. GradatimFerociter pic.twitter.comS6vG6KfRRD - Blue Origin (blueorigin) January 15, 2020 "We're honored to fly the US flag on New Shepard - this vehicle, our very own, 100 made in the USA," Bezos wrote in a tweet. The test flight was delayed from 2018, and Blue Origin is still working on the capsule it will use to send tourists to space. Blue Origin has been working on reusable rockets to reach suborbital space for a few years now. That's space that's just outside the boundary of Earth's atmosphere, but not far enough to orbit the Earth. The company has successfully launched and landed New Shepard 13 times, and has now launched and landed the rocket five times in a row. Tuesday's flight was the first time New Shepard flew a capsule with the same parachutes it will use to land tourists. "We've already started to manufacture the first flight test escape motor for capsule escape and have started building the first test article of the capsule abort motor," Blue Origin said in its preflight video. "In parallel, our New Shepard flight test program is continuing." Bezos first announced plans for New Shepard in November 2015. The capsule and rocket are designed to launch people to suborbital space - a little more than 62 miles above the Earth's surface. Blue Origin plans to use the same technology to build a lunar lander, as part of the company's goal to help NASA send people to the moon by 2024. "The first New Shepard mission that flies with people on board will also carry scientific payloads and Blue Origin's charter science manager, Dr. Kristin Kierstead, will help ensure those payloads are integrated and conducting experiments in line with mission objectives," Blue Origin said. Blue Origin said in July 2018 that the first crewed New Shepard flight would take place before the end of that year. The company delayed the flight, and has not yet announced when it will launch people into space. "As we've said before, we're going to fly the hell out of this vehicle before we put our test pilots on board," Ariane Cornell, Blue Origin's head of astronaut strategy and sales, told Business Insider in November 2018. "And that's exactly what we're doing." SEE ALSO: SpaceX just launched a space station supply mission. Here

original_text: The New York Times has acquired Serial Productions, the audio production company behind popular podcast series Serial. Serial Productions was formed in 2017 after the success of the podcast, which has been downloaded over 300 million times since its launch in 2014. Serial Productions' first project was S-Town, a 2017 spin-off series from Serial. S-Town has been downloaded over 100 million times, according to Apple. The company's next project, an investigative podcast about a troubled adoption agency called This American Life, is slated to premiere later this year. It will be produced by Reply All co-host Sruthi Pinnamaneni, who previously worked as an editor on Serial and S-Town. In addition to producing its own original content, Serial Productions will continue to consult on other programs. The company has worked with MSNBC to create a podcast about Russian interference in the 2016 U.S. presidential election, and is working on a podcast with the Gates Foundation about global health and development. "We are incredibly excited to join forces with the New York Times to help support and grow the next generation of audio storytelling," said Julie Snyder, co-founder and CEO of Serial Productions, in a statement. The Times will report that Serial Productions had 1.1 million in revenue in 2018, but it's unclear how much of that money came from ads.
text: The New York Times has acquired Serial Productions, the audio production company behind popular podcast series Serial, in a deal reported to be worth $12.5 million.

original_text: The 61st International Mathematical Olympiad (IMO) is the first IMO that has been held remotely and may also be the last time that artificial intelligence doesn't compete. Researchers view the IMO as a particularly vulnerable target because its questions require proof rather than a numerical answer. "AI already beats humans in board games. It's going to be so easy to replace humans in these contests," said Dr Joel Hamkins, a mathematician and philosopher at the City University of New York. Dr Hamkins gave a presentation about the use of AI in IMO at the Joint Mathematics Meetings in January 2019 and an overview of the issues with the Associated Press. In his opinion, there is no reason why the IMO cannot be automated. For example, if a computer could solve a problem, it could be programmed to provide a full proof for the solution. "The IMO is simply a test of who has learned the most math," he said. "And in the future, the AI will be able to learn the same amount of math as a human being." The contest is a very vulnerable target because it requires proof rather than a numerical answer. Dr Hamkins has been using the latest developments in AI to create 'impossible' math problems that, in theory, no human could solve. The goal is to encourage the development of new AI systems that could outperform humans in solving mathematical problems. He has already created an AI that is capable of solving mathematical problems equivalent to first-year undergraduate math. However, it is not very fast and requires a lot of memory space. "For a computer to be able to do a good job of answering a math question, it has to understand what the question is asking. Humans can do that, but machines can struggle." "But if the math problem is easy enough and you're trying to solve it with a computer, then the difficulty is going to be too easy." "If you get the level right, then it's really hard to get the proof. And if you get the level wrong, then it's really easy to get the proof. The difficulty of getting the level right is one of the things that makes the IMO hard." "We're still at the point where it's very hard to get the difficulty level just right." In the future, AI will be able to learn the same amount of math as a human being. Dr Hamkins predicts that the 62nd IMO in 2021 will be the last IMO that is conducted manually. "I don't know whether we will be ready to have an IMO that is fully run by AI by the 2021 IMO, but I think that's a good goal to shoot for," he said. The 61st IMO is being held in Bath, UK. This is the first IMO that has been held remotely. More than 600 students from 100 countries competed in the first round in July. The IMO has been held annually since 1959, with 104 countries participating. The competition is very popular in China and Russia, but it is also growing in popularity in many countries including the United States. The IMO is held in a different country each year. The country acts as host and organises and runs the event. The IMO Advisory Board (IAB) oversees the IMO and is supported by the International Mathematical Union.
text: The world's best mathematicians are gathering in London this week to compete in a contest that could be the last time a human will take part.

original_text: A network of radio telescopes in the Netherlands made detailed recordings of a lightning bolt during a summer storm in 2018. The recordings, which were processed only recently, show lightning starting up inside a thundercloud. They were used to create a 3D image of the lightning. The pattern of pulses recorded indicates that lightning starts with clusters of ice inside of a cloud. An animation of the lightning flash is available in the article.

original_text: Google's DeepMind AI team has successfully trained its software to control a tokamak. Small reactors like tokamaks use software to monitor the state of the plasma they contain and respond to any changes. Control software tends to be fairly specialized. A rewrite is usually required if scientists want to experiment with different plasma configurations. DeepMind's software can produce different plasma configurations in real hardware. The model could be used to find ways to optimize existing hardware.

It uses Bluetooth, WebRTS, and peer-to-peer Wi-Fi to send files directly. The feature still needs to go through the Chrome OS Canary developer flag stage before Chrome OS users will see it on their devices.
